Nathan Duggins
Resume Portfolio Contact

Summary

Versatile GIS technician, award-winning cartographer and certified Part 107 UAV pilot with over 1,000 flight hours, currently working at CACI International Inc. specializing in satellite imagery interpretation and digitization. Proficient in GIS and remote sensing techniques such as georectification, spectral analysis, and elevation modeling, with hands-on experience in projects like mapping for the National Park Service and post-flood reconstruction assessments. Skilled in software platforms for photogrammetry, point cloud data processing, and GIS analysis. My background includes over two decades in retail management and the successful creation of a UAV mapping business, demonstrating entrepreneurial skills and leadership in team management and training. Currently pursuing a bachelorâ€™s degree in GIS with a 4.0 GPA, bringing a unique blend of technical expertise, practical experience, and business acumen to the field of geospatial technology.

Skills and Abilities

GIS Skills

  • Georectified historical images using accurate, current base maps.
  • Extracted spectral signatures from satellite images and analyzed them.
  • Used band math and indexes to analyze and interpret imagery.
  • Analyzed changes in elevation and land use type due to major flooding event using DEMs and satellite imagery classification.
  • Performed an analysis on remote power pole locations, including their clustering characteristics, in order to judge project feasibility.
  • Collected and processed data using an aerial sensor platform (UAV), including Canupo point cloud classification/segmentation and DEM creation using a cloth simulation filtering algorithm.

Software Skills

  • Photogrammetry software such as Agisoft Metashape, Pix4d and OpenDronemap.
  • Experience working with point cloud data in CloudCompare and Meshlab.
  • GIS software such as ArcGIS and QGIS
  • Video editing sofware such as Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects
  • Photo/Design software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Lightroom.
  • Microsoft sofware such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

Business Skills

  • Run a successful small business that is currently owned and operated by me.
  • 20+ years of retail management experience.
  • Extensive monthly trainings (3+ years) in effective management techniques through Fedex Office's management training program.
  • Regularly conducted interviews, training sessions, and coaching sessions for several companies.

Practical Field Projects

National Park Service - Point Reyes National Park

  • Mapped several Northern California beaches in the Point Reyes National Park with a multispectral sensor mounted on a UAV and collected ground control points.
  • Processed the resulting data into final deliverables including orthophotos, calibrated reflectance layers and digital elevation maps.
  • Aided in the creation of classification rasters highlighting the different local flora and fauna in the intertidal regions of the park.

University of Northern Colorado/City of Longmont

  • Mapped a 2.25mi stretch of the Saint Vrain Creek in Longmont, CO. with the goal of aiding in the assessment of the reconstruction efforts since the 2013 flood.
  • This map sets a baseline for future research into the ecological effects of human-centered reconstruction efforts.
  • Along with maps created at nearby sites, it allows for comparison with other, more ecologically-minded reconstruction projects in the region.
